data.prayer: Jesus, you are the great high priest, please make the 684 believers in Chlef, Algeria a worthy priesthood under you.
data.verse: Since then we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Chlef, Algeria
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, as people seek answers on the internet, please help them find the gospel in Chlef, Algeria.
data.verse: So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

data.prayer: Jesus, please send your Spirit to Chlef, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.prayer: Spirit, encourage those who are afraid in Chlef, Algeria that you are the healer and you are the Savior.
data.verse: Heal me, Lord, and I will be healed; save me and I will be saved, for you are the one I praise.

data.prayer: Lord, remember the Bedouin, Ziban people. Make the Bedouin, Ziban people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Lord, the believers in the state of Chlef, Algeria need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Jesus, like with the centurion who came to you for his sick servant, please call into your house those who have great faith but are not yet yours in the state of Chlef
data.verse: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turning to the crowd that followed him, said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.” And when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant well.

data.prayer: Father, answer the requests of your people in the state of Chlef.
data.verse: This is the boldness which we have toward him, that, if we ask anything according to his will, he listens to us.
